abstractContent.text: We present a web service for natural language parsing, prediction, generation, and translation using grammars in Portable Grammar Format (PGF), the target format of the Grammatical Framework (GF) grammar compiler.

entities.text: natural language parsing, prediction, generation, and translation

abstractContent.text: The web service implementation is open source, works with any PGF grammar, and with any web server that supports FastCGI.
The service exposes a simple interface which makes it possible to use it for interactive natural language web applications.
We describe the function-ality and interface of the web service, and demonstrate several applications built on top of it.

introductionContent.text: Current web applications often consist of JavaScript code that runs in the user's web browser, with serverside code that does the heavy lifting.
We present a web service for natural language processing with Portable Grammar Format (PGF, grammars, which can be used to build interactive natural language web applications.
PGF is the back-end format to which Grammatical Framework (GF,) grammars are compiled.
PGF has been designed to allow efficient implementations.
The web service has a simple API based solely on HTTP GET requests.
It returns responses in JavaScript Object Notation).
The serverside program is distributed as part of the GF software distribution, under the GNU General Public License (GPL).
The program is generic, in the sense that it can be used with any PGF grammar without any modification of the program.
